    public interface UiWidgetAbstractComposite
extends UiWidget
    This is the abstract interface for an UiWidget that is a composite. Composite means that is may have children.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getChildIndex

        int getChildIndex(UiWidget child)
        This method determines the index of the given child in the list of children of this composite.
        The signature is by intention not using the generic to support delegation without suffering by the java compiler.
        Parameters:
        child - is the potential child.
        Returns:
        the index of the given child or -1 if it is NOT a child of this composite.
        See Also:
        List.indexOf(Object)

      • getChild

        UiWidget getChild(int index)
           throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        This method gets the child at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - is the index of the requested child. Has to be in the range from 0 to getChildCount() - 1.
        Returns:
        the requested child.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given index is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        List.get(int)

      • getChild

        UiWidget getChild(String childId)
        This method gets the child with the given id.
        Parameters:
        childId - is the ID of the requested child.
        Returns:
        the child with the given id or null if no such child exists.

      • getChildCount

        int getChildCount()
        This method gets the number of children in this composite.
        Returns:
        the child count.
